poem:
**Displaced**

Italy's embrace, a maritime dance,  
hearts adrift on foreign tides —  
Albania receives the murmurs,  
whispered between waves and sky.  
A pact woven of restless currents,  
seeking shorelines in twilight's hold.  
Lives unfold as sails unfurl —  
hope and borders intertwine.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Italy sends first asylum seekers to Albania under controversial pact The first people to be intercepted at sea by the Italian navy under a controversial migration deal with Albania are on their way to the Balkan nation to have their asylum claims processed. As part of the pact signed off on by Italy’s far-right prime minister, Giorgia Meloni, a navy ship set off on Monday “with some irregular migrants onboard”, the interior ministry confirmed. The". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
